languageKey.label: SAV Library Kickstarter > Types > Relation n-n as subform
Attributes for the type "Database many-to-many (n:n) relation as subform"
xEXT_sav_library_kickstarter_all:*,xEXT_sav_library_kickstarter_functions:*,xEXT_sav_library_kickstarter_general:*
addDelete = 1;
A delete icon will be added in front of each item.
addUpDown = 1;
Two buttons (up and down) will be added. They can be used to reorganize the order of the subform items.
addSave = 1;
A save button and an anchor will be added. It simplifies the saving when several items are in the subform and the height of an item is important.
maxSubItems = integer;
Number of items that will be displayed in the subform. All items are displayed if set to 0. Only for "basic" library type.
maxSubformItems = integer;
Number of items that will be displayed in the subform. All items are displayed if set to 0. Use maxSubformItems for "plus" library type.
keepFieldsInSubForm = comma-separated list of fields;

The values of the fields (use tableName.fieldName) from the parent form will be kept in the subform. It can be used to deal with these values in the subform. If * is used instead of the comma-separated list of fields, all fields are kept. Only for "basic" library type.
cutNewButtonIfNotSaved = 1;
The new button of the subform will be cut if the form in which the subform takes place is not saved.
labelOnTitle = 1;
The label will be displayed in the title of the subform in input mode.
noFirstLast = 1;
First and last buttons in the browser associated with the subform will not be shown.
subFormTemplate = string;
Name of the template (e.g. subFormAlt). By default the template "subForm" is used. Only for "basic" library type.
subformTitle = string;
If set, the string will be displayed in the title bar of the subform. Localization tags and markers can be used. Only for "plus" library type.
